h1901.definition: from an unused root akin to {{h1897}}; properly, a murmur, i.e. complaint; meditation, musing.

h1902.definition: intensive from {{h1897}}; a murmuring sound, i.e. a musical notation (probably similar to the modern affettuoso to indicate solemnity of movement); by implication, a machination; device, Higgaion, meditation, solemn sound.

h1903.definition: of uncertain derivation; perhaps suitable or turning; directly.

h1904.definition: of uncertain (perhaps foreign) derivation; Hagar, the mother of Ishmael; Hagar.

h1905.definition: or (prolonged) הַגְרִיאxlit Hagrîʼ corrected to Hagrîyʼ; perhaps patronymically from {{h1904}}; a Hagrite or member of a certain Arabian clan; Hagarene, Hagarite, Haggeri.

h1907.definition: (Aramaic) probably of foreign origin; a vizier; counsellor.

h1908.definition: probably of foreign origin (compare {{h111}}); Hadad, the name of an idol, and of several kings of Edom; Hadad.

h1909.definition: from {{h1908}} and {{h5828}}; Hadad (is his) help; Hadadezer, a Syrian king; Hadadezer. Compare {{h1928}}.

h1910.definition: from {{h1908}} and {{h7417}}; Hadad-Rimmon, a place in Palestine; Hadad-rimmon.

h1911.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h3034}}); to stretch forth the hand; put.

h1912.definition: of foreign origin; Hodu (i.e. Hindustan); India.

h1913.definition: or הֲדֹרָם; probably of foreign derivation; Hadoram, a son of Joktan, and the tribe descended from him; Hadoram.

h1914.definition: of uncertain derivation; Hiddai, an Israelite; Hiddai.

h1915.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h1854}}); to crush with the foot; tread down.

h1916.definition: from an unused root meaning to stamp upon; a footstool; (foot-) stool.

h1917.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of {{h1916}}; something stamped to pieces, i.e. a bit; piece.

h1918.definition: of uncertain derivation; the myrtle; myrtle (tree).

h1920.definition: a primitive root; to push away or down; cast away (out), drive, expel, thrust (away).

h1921.definition: a primitive root; to swell up (literally or figuratively, active or passive); by implication, to favor or honour, be high or proud; countenance, crooked place, glorious, honour, put forth.

h1922.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1921}}; to magnify (figuratively); glorify, honour.

h1924.definition: the same as {{h1926}}; Hadar, an Edomite; Hadar.

h1925.definition: from {{h1921}}; honour; used (figuratively) for the capital city (Jerusalem); glory.

h1926.definition: from {{h1921}}; magnificence, i.e. ornament or splendor; beauty, comeliness, excellency, glorious, glory, goodly, honour, majesty.

h1928.definition: from {{h1924}} and {{h5828}}; Hadar (i.e. Hadad, {{h1908}}) is his help; (i.e. Hadadezer, {{h1909}}); Hadarezer,	a Syrian king; Hadarezer.

h1929.definition: a shortened form of {{h162}}; ah! expressing grief; woe worth.

h1931.definition: of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; he a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who.

h1932.definition: (Aramaic) or (feminine) הִיא; (Aramaic), corresponding to {{h1931}}; × are, it, this.

h1933.definition: or הָוָה; a primitive root (compare {{h183}}, {{h1961}}) supposed to mean properly, to breathe; to be (in the sense of existence); be, × have.

h1934.definition: (Aramaic) or הָוָה; (Aramaic), corresponding to {{h1933}}; to exist; used in a great variety of applications (especially in connection with other words); be, become,   behold,   came (to pass),   cease,   cleave,   consider,   do,   give,   have,   judge,   keep,   labour,   mingle (self),   put,   see,   seek,   set,   slay,   take heed, tremble,   walk,   would.

h1935.definition: from an unused root; grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance); beauty, comeliness, excellency, glorious, glory, goodly, honour, majesty.

h1936.definition: the same as {{h1935}}; Hod, an Israelite; Hod.

h1937.definition: a form of {{h1938}}; Hodevah (or Hodevjah), an Israelite; Hodevah.

h1938.definition: from {{h1935}} and {{h3050}}; majesty of Jah; Hodavjah, the name of three Israelites; Hodaviah.

h1939.definition: a form of {{h1938}}; Hodajvah, an Israelite; Hodaiah.

h1940.definition: a form for the feminine of {{h3064}}; a Jewess; Hodiah.

h1941.definition: a form of {{h1938}}; Hodijah, the name of three Israelites; Hodijah.

h1942.definition: from {{h1933}} (in the sense of eagerly coveting and rushing upon; by implication, of falling); desire; also ruin; calamity, iniquity, mischief, mischievous (thing), naughtiness, naughty, noisome, perverse thing, substance, very wickedness.

h1944.definition: of uncertain derivation; Hoham, a Canaanitish king; Hoham.

h1945.definition: a prolonged form of {{h1930}} (akin to {{h188}}); oh!; ah, alas, ho, O, woe.

h1946.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1981}}; to go; causatively, to bring; bring again, come, go (up).

h1947.definition: feminine active participle of {{h1984}}; folly; madness.

h1948.definition: from active participle of {{h1984}}; folly; madness.

h1949.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2000}}); to make an uproar, or agitate greatly; destroy, move, make a noise, put, ring again.

h1950.definition: from {{h2000}}; raging; Homam, an Edomitish chieftain; Homam. Compare {{h1967}}.

h1951.definition: a primitive root; properly, to be naught, i.e. (figuratively) to be (causatively, act) light; be ready.

h1952.definition: from the same as {{h1951}} in the sense of {{h202}}; wealth; by implication, enough; enough,   for nought, riches, substance, wealth.

h1953.definition: from {{h3068}} and {{h8085}}; Jehovah has heard; Hoshama, an Israelite; Hoshama.

h1954.definition: from {{h3467}}; deliverer; Hoshea, the name of five Israelites; Hosea, Hoshea, Oshea.

h1955.definition: from {{h3467}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has saved; Hoshajah, the name of two Israelites; Hoshaiah.

h1956.definition: from {{h3498}}; he has caused to remain; Hothir, an Israelite; Hothir.

h1957.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2372}}); to dream; sleep.

h1959.definition: from an unused root (meaning to shout); acclamation; shout(-ing).

h1960.definition: from the same as {{h1959}}; properly, an acclaim, i.e. a choir of singers; thanksgiving.

h1961.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h1933}}); to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary); beacon, × altogether, be(-come), accomplished, committed, like), break, cause, come (to pass), do, faint, fall,   follow, happen, × have, last, pertain, quit (one-) self, require, × use.

h1964.definition: probably from {{h3201}} (in the sense of capacity); a large public building, such as a palace or temple; palace, temple.

h1966.definition: from {{h1984}} (in the sense of brightness); the morning-star; lucifer.

h1967.definition: another form for {{h1950}}; Hemam, an Idumaean; Hemam.

h1968.definition: probably from {{h539}}; faithful; Heman, the name of at least two Israelites; Heman.

h1969.definition: probably of Egyptian origin; a hin or liquid measure; hin.

h1970.definition: a primitive root; apparently; to injure; make self strange.

h1972.definition: probably denominatively from {{h1973}}; to remove or be remote; cast far off.

h1973.definition: from the primitive form of the article (hal); to the distance, i.e. far away; also (of time) thus far; back, beyond, (hence,-) forward, hitherto, thence, forth, yonder.

h1974.definition: from {{h1984}} (in the sense of rejoicing); a celebration of thanksgiving for harvest; merry, praise.

h1975.definition: from {{h1976}}; this or that; side, that, this.

h1976.definition: from the article (see {{h1973}}) and {{h2088}}; this very; this.

h1978.definition: from {{h1980}}; a walk, i.e. (by implication) a step; step.

h1979.definition: feminine of {{h1978}}; a walking; by implication, a procession or march, a caravan; company, going, walk, way.

h1980.definition: akin to {{h3212}}; a primitive root; to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively); (all) along, apace, behave (self), come, (on) continually, be conversant, depart,   be eased, enter, exercise (self),   follow, forth, forward, get, go (about, abroad, along, away, forward, on, out, up and down),   greater, grow, be wont to haunt, lead, march, × more and more, move (self), needs, on, pass (away), be at the point, quite, run (along),   send, speedily, spread, still, surely,   tale-bearer,   travel(-ler), walk (abroad, on, to and fro, up and down, to places), wander, wax, (way-) faring man, × be weak, whirl.

h1982.definition: from {{h1980}}; properly, a journey, i.e. (by implication) a wayfarer; also a flowing; × dropped, traveller.

h1983.definition: (Aramaic) from {{h1981}}; properly, a journey, i.e. (by implication) toll on goods at a road; custom.

h1984.definition: a primitive root; to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make a show, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify; (make) boast (self), celebrate, commend, (deal, make), fool(-ish, -ly), glory, give (light), be (make, feign self) mad (against), give in marriage, (sing, be worthy of) praise, rage, renowned, shine.

h1985.definition: from {{h1984}}; praising (namely God); Hillel, an Israelite; Hillel.

h1986.definition: a primitive root; to strike down; by implication, to hammer, stamp, conquer, disband; beat (down), break (down), overcome, smite (with the hammer).

h1987.definition: from {{h1986}}; smiter; Helem, the name of two Israelites; Helem.

h1988.definition: from the article (see {{h1973}}); hither; here, hither(-(to)), thither.

h1990.definition: of uncertain derivation; Ham, a region of Palestine; Ham.

h1991.definition: from {{h1993}}; abundance, i.e. wealth; any of theirs.

h1992.definition: or (prolonged) הֵמָּה; masculine plural from {{h1931}}; they (only used when emphatic); it, like, × (how, so) many (soever, more as) they (be), (the) same, × so, × such, their, them, these, they, those, which, who, whom, withal, ye.

h1993.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h1949}}); to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor; clamorous, concourse, cry aloud, be disquieted, loud, mourn, be moved, make a noise, rage, roar, sound, be troubled, make in tumult, tumultuous, be in an uproar.

h1994.definition: (Aramaic) or (prolonged) הִמּוֹן; (Aramaic), corresponding to {{h1992}}; they; × are, them, those.

h1995.definition: or הָמֹן; (Ezekiel 5:7), from {{h1993}}; a noise, tumult, crowd; also disquietude, wealth; abundance, company, many, multitude, multiply, noise, riches, rumbling, sounding, store, tumult.

h1996.definition: from {{h1995}} and {{h1463}}; the multitude of Gog; the fanciful name of an emblematic place in Palestine; Hamon-gog.

h1997.definition: feminine of {{h1995}}; multitude; , the same as {{h1996}}; Hamonah; Hamonah.

h1999.definition: or (too fully) הֲמוּלָּה; (Jeremiah 11:16), feminine passive participle of an unused root meaning to rush (as rain with a windy roar); a sound; speech, tumult.

h2000.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h1949}}, {{h1993}}); properly, to put in commotion; by implication, to disturb, drive, destroy; break, consume, crush, destroy, discomfit, trouble, vex.
